job description:
Who You Will Be:

Wizard with data who can both analyze it and also find/extract/transform the data as necessary. Will work on our own large internal data sets as well as sourcing new relevant data sets.

Requirements:
  • Must be able to write code, at least in R/Matlab, but probably in Python or similar.
  • Must understand probability and statistics well. You will be tested on this and must have a very good understanding of the underlying math.
  • Basic understanding of matrix algebra, differential equations/dynamical systems, combinatorics, set theory, and operations research.
  • Basic understanding of natural language processing, web indexing, and search.
  • Understand MapReduce and other parallel processing concepts.
Responsibilities:
  • Help create your own datasets and identify targets for web scraping, data exchange, and other data import/extraction.
  • Work on big data applications, helping to create features in our products.
  • Create 'ETL' logic for structuring unstructured or semi-structured datasets.
  • Create models and problem-solving approaches for problems in bioinformatics, advertising, social graph insights, and scientific computing.
  • Work on natural language processing problems, topology problems, and operations optimization problems with a variety of datasets.
  • Work on high-level and low-level algorithms for NP-hard problems (subset problem, phylogenetics, traveling salesman, genetic algorithms, scheduling, Bayesian Networks, hidden Markov Model/Viterbi pathing).
